definition: scowling in anger/rage written across one's face

sentences.english: Her angry face amounts to her expression of not liking you.
sentences.chinese: 她的怒容等於告訴你，她不喜歡你。

sentences.english: He glanced up with a scowl .
Voice did not lie, a full face of farming presented the thunder.
sentences.chinese: 話音未落，滿臉怒容的農呈現了。

sentences.english: His eyes quailed before her angry looks .
sentences.chinese: 在她的怒容前，他的眼睛裏顯出畏懼的。

sentences.english: Her face held a suggestion of anger.
Springing to her feet, her face wrathful, the woman stared at that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 那個婦女跳了起來，怒容滿面，直瞪着那個傢伙。

sentences.english: Up jumped Peter with an angry on his face.
sentences.chinese: 彼得跳了起來，滿臉怒容。

sentences.english: Her rebukes and angries are seemly full of all room.
sentences.chinese: 她的責問和怒容，好象佈滿了整個房子。

sentences.english: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
sentences.chinese: 北風生雨，讒謗人的舌頭也生怒容。

sentences.english: The old woman straightened herself up in a fury.
sentences.chinese: 老婆子伸直了腰，怒容滿面。

sentences.english: They held up at the gate.
sentences.chinese: 海利站在門口怒容滿面。

sentences.english: He was sitting there with a face of gloomy thunder.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那兒，一臉陰沉的怒容。

definition: scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
